reviews.review: I am recomending it for being a neatly upgraded version of Half-Life. By Upgraded, I mean that the water is very pretty. Despite my recomendation, I did encounter a few glitches. In the conveyor belt area, the graphics were popping around so badly, I could not see where I was going. There was also a game breaking glitch where I could not progress past a door and it forced me to cheat to get past the problem. Keep that in mind, if you buy it. But remember! Pretty water...

As many others will say, the graphical improvements are not worth the bugs that come with them. Buy the original, not the source version.

I played this because I happened to have it on an old Steam account, perhaps because it came in some package deal - I don't remember anymore. It is still worth playing in such a case. But it also helps that I played the original so much before that I remembered the scripted events by heart. If it weren't for that, I'd be missing a decent amount of the story to bugs, and that is sad. The other bugs are tolerable but the story is such an important aspect of the game that this would be reason enough alone to implore you to play the original.

I also have to report a game breaking bug that basically forced me to use cheats to advance the game (at the fire pipe at the end of Surface Tension - the door doesn't open). I've heard this bug sometimes also pops up on the original half life, but it was certainly the icing on the buggy cake for me.

It's buggy, it fucked with the puzzles, Valve never gave it anymore attention after the quick transfer over to Source. And yet it's still more preferable to the 2 official expansion packs.

There is a certain charm to it, not for everyone sure, but it's still funny rag-dolling your enemies and exploiting the wonky physics to hilarious degrees.

Short version: Go buy Black Mesa. If you want to know why this game is a fucking joke, by all means, proceed. 

HL Source is the only bad Valve game ever released. It's honestly unbelievable how awful and fundamentally broken this one is, Valve managed to take their most iconic game- not to mention the one which launched their company to stardom, and absolutely deprive it of quality. For 10 bucks, what do you get from HL Source? An unplayable mess full of broken scripted sequences, broken NPCs, unbalanced weapons and damage systems, infuriating glitches, levels so broken you can't win, levels so broken you can't lose, just a total disaster. I hate to repeat myself so much, but this game is a broken mess. Even the Garry's Mod content is pretty lackluster, you'd be better off with a free mod like Half Life Renaissance. Oh, and for fans of the HD models that came with Blue Shift, don't even bother. For one they seem to be modified from the original release (why bother with such tiny changes?) and most importantly, the models are incomplete showing wireframes, and even the sounds on the guns like the M4 and SPAS-12 are missing altogether. 

The "selling points" of HL Source include a HL2 style chapter select, improved Source Engine lighting, HL2 style water, and ragdoll physics. That's it. For ten bucks. How could Valve have gone so wrong? Counter Strike Source and Day of Defeat Source offered complete Source remakes of their predecessors, so why are we stuck with this awful port instead of a real remake, like the mod Black Mesa? And more importantly, why hasn't Valve even bothered to make this garbarge at least functional? It's full of little distracting mistakes any HL series veteran will notice immediately. Just a mess.

I will say the Deathmatch multiplayer is fun. You can actually get this in a pack of other Source multiplayer titles without having to get HL Source. DMS has a lot of the same problems as Source, but luckily the abudance of great community made maps makes it worthwhile.

Most reviews talk of glitches and bugs but I never encountered a single one. Maybe I was just lucky or maybe the reviewers were lying. Who knows.

But anyway. I wanted to check out Half-Life since I got sucked into the Portal universe (and hearing that Aperture Science and Black Mesa were linked somehow) and it was recommended that I get the Source version as opposed to the original. So I did.

I actually really enjoyed the story. An experiment at Black Mesa goes wrong and it's up to silent protagonist Gordon Freeman to set it all right again. And despite being a scientist, he's a damn good shot with a gun or he'll really smart you with a crowbar. The gunplay feels good and movement is good, though sometimes jumps can be a little floaty.

I never judge a game on graphics but either way, the graphics are good for a game of this agel, and a HD retexture is included. Both sets look good but graphics do not make a game.

The gameplay itself is good and the difficulty has good progression, so you start with easier enemies and then as the game progresses, you face tougher enemies. Occasionally the difficulty can spike in places but this is usually doe to miniboss encounters, which is expected.

Either way, this was definitely a fun experience and I would highly recommend it.

Rovnou na začátek.. Pro mě je Half-Life nuda. Ano, chápu, je to stará hra, ale znám stejně staré hry, co mě baví mnohem mnohem víc např. Thief, NFS 3, Tomb Raider 3, Caesar 3 nebo legendární Commandos.

Nikdy před tím jsem hru nehrál. Když jsem všude možně četl, jak je to jedna z nejlepších her, donutilo mě to si jí koupit v balíčku HL Complete. Když jsem viděl vzhled jedničky, radši jsem si rovnou zapnul Source. Nešli mi v něm české titulky, tak jsem si to musel stáhnout a hrát non-steam. Bohužel Source hře moc nepomohl. Vzhledově je to lepší, to ano, ale tahle hra je nyní už pouze určena lidem, co jí hráli při jejím vydání, nebo na hře vyrůstali.

Čekal jsem nějaký epický nebo hlubší příběh, ale toho se mi prakticky nedostalo. Místo toho jsem dostal v dnešní době již nudnou, koridorovou střílečku, u které jsem si už po 2 hodinách začal říkat "Doufám, že už bude brzo konec..". 

Spoiler! (jestli je to teda vůbec třeba...)

Příběh je jednoduchej a nudnej, žádná extrémní zápletka. V laboratoři, kde pracujete, nevyjde experiment s teleportérem a otevře se brána do jiné dimenze, odkuď začne přilejzat mimozemská havěť. Vaším úkolem je to zastavit. Po cestě k tomuto cílí střílíte po všem co se hýbe. Puzzly tomu vůbec nepomáhali, akorát mě štvali. Na konci vás čeká boss, u kterého zničíte 3 krystali na zdi co ho chrání, zpoza kamene ho roztřílíte, dáte mu ránu do hlavy a konec. Naprostá nuda. I CoD mají promyšlenější příběh. 

Pohybování je otřesný, Freeman je jak na ledu nebo co. Souboje nejsou nějak zajímavé, NPC jsou tupí, prakticky se vůbec nekryjí a když se skryjete vy, tak běží přímo naproti vám a když vylezete, zastaví se uprostřed a prostě a jednoduše tam stojí a střílí, dokud je nezabijete. Soundtrack je hodně zvláštní. Absolutně mi k tomu nesedí snad ani jedna skladba, co v tom zahrála. Jediné, co ve hře tak nějak ujde je level desing. Bohužel to platí jen pro některé levely. Někdy to jsou prostě jen nudné a prázdné chodby.

Pokud jste hru nehráli a hrajete moderní hry, ani si jí nekupujte, nemá to moc smysl. Hra je podle mě hratlná jen pro nostalgiky. Po hrách, které už mám za sebou, je pro mě Half-life jedna z nejhorších a nejnudnějších her, co jsem kdy hrál. Chtěl jsem ji dohrát, abych si potom mohl zahrál dvojku, ale nakonec koukám, že to byla ztráta času a mohl jsem jít rovnou na dvojku. Doufám, že ta bude lepší...

1. Visual glitches showing a wide variety of colours on the screen making it impossible to see where you are going.
2. The shittiest walking physics I have seen, it feels as if you are walking on ice, and during the part where you are traversing a mountain this becomes excessively annoying. Sometimes you also get glued to the mountain and all of a sudden you are released from its buggy grasp. 
3. shooting mechanics that have not aged that well. getting into fire fights with soldiers is not recommended.
4. no safety whatsoever when respawning sometimes. There is a risk of getting spawnkilled on some occasions, which is unacceptable as it might make your save file redundant.

Half Life, Half Life (:Source), tu as été admiré par la crtique, 96 de score metacritic, et je comprends des a présent pourquoi. Pour vous expliquer brievement, vous êtes gordon freeman, scientifique muet, bossant pour black mesa. Suite a une experience raté, voila que la base est rempli d'extrateresse: votre but sera de degager les extrateresse, mais aussi une autre faction [spoiler]L'armée (visiblement engagé par black mesa) qui veut pas que cette histoire fasse la une des journaux[/spoiler]
Ce jeu est un jeu, c'est con a dire, mais 3 seconde de cinematique pour 10h de jeu, ca fait du bien. On se sent interactif, on invite des garde a nous vivre, des scientifiques a nous soigner a la simple pression d'une touche, ca fait du bien dans cette periode ou chez les AAA, seul les graphismes compte.
L'histoire du jeu est basique, je parle ici que du premier half life. Ce scenar nous inviter a son jeu d'une facon efficace. De ce que j'ai compri, si on joue a toutes les extension et aux half life 2, l'histoire est d'autant meilleur, c'est ce que je verifirais dans les jours a venir.
Le gameplay est efficace, c'est dommage que l'on ai plus de FPS-Couloir-Puzzle comme half life, meme si cle jeu date de 1998, il a su m'apporter un vent de fraicheur, j'ai trouvé son gameplay plutot exemplaire, les niveaux sont pensé de facon a ce qu'on ai quasi toujour des munitions alors que les vie et l'armure sont logiquement plus difficile a trouver.
Le systeme du "sauvegarde quand tu veux", m'a sauvé la mise nombre de fois, vu la dificulte du jeu, je sais pas si je l'aurais fini sans ca.
Allez, maitenant les points faible:
-Les [spoiler]soldats de l'armée[/spoiler] sont trop dur a tuer, ils ont plein de vie, court un peu partout, et ils font mal. Bon apres si on trouve un angle mort, on peut les tuer avec le magnum ou l'arbalete assez aisement, mais des qu'ils sont 4-5, c'est chaud.
-Spoil boss de fin:[spoiler]Le boss qui te tp partout a x moment m'a tellement saoulé, il aurait fallu juste laisser des munitions au debut et voili voila[/spoiler]
-La version source, de ce que j'en ai entendu, est plus beugué que la version normal, alors que H-L:source propose des graphsmes legerement meilleur. J'ai juste noté 3 bugs relou, a part ca, nickel. Donc c'est comme vous voulez, HL pour des graphismes legerement moin bien, avec moin de bug ou source pour l'inverse, les deux sont au même prix
Voila, en bref foncez prendre le jeux, ca vous fera un vent de fraicheur sur les FPS qu'on se tape ajd.

Half Life: Source, 1998 yılında yayınlanan Half Life'ın devamı olan 2004 yılında yayınlanmış Half Life 2'de kullanılmış olan Source motoruyla yeniden yapılmış halidir. Konu, oynanış, görüntü (ufak tefek farklar dışında) orijinal sürümle tamamen aynıdır. Değişiklikler ise, bazı dokuların görünümünde iyileştirmeler (örneğin su), çizgilerde daha yumuşak geçişler, fizikte birtakım değişiklikler (öldürülen canavarların plastik oyuncak gibi değil, ceset gibi ses çıkarması ve yığılması, havada asılı duran ve üzerine zıplanan kutuların sallanması) olarak sayılabilir.

Hiç bilmeyenler için konudan bahsedelim. FPS tarzı olan bu oyunda, Fizik Uzmanı olan ve bir deney için Black Mesa tesislerine gelen Gordon Freeman'ı kontrol ediyoruz. Deney esnasında birşeyler ters gider ve oyunun ilerleyen bölümlerinde de ziyaret edeceğimiz Xen adlı Dünya dışı boyuttan Dünya'ya canavarlar gelmeye başlar. Biz de, karakteristik silahımız olan levye ve sonradan edineceğimiz birçok silahla, amansız bir mücadeleye girişerek, bir taraftan yeryüzüne ulaşıp yardım getirmeye çalışır, bir taraftan yolumuza çıkan 'ucubelerle' savaşırız.

Oyunu hiç oynamayıp Half Life 2'yi oynamak isteyenlere kesinlikle tavsiye edilir. Half Life orijinal sürümü oynamış olanlar için yeni bir şey yok, yukarıda sayılan iyileştirmeler dışında.

So this is the first time I have ever played a Half-Life game, and in my first 2 hours of playing, I can say that this game is fantastic. It does not have 10 to 20 minute cutscenes with loads of dialogue, nor is it a team multiplayer that you respawn in several times per round, but it is the beginning of the fps with a plot and the chaotic environment of Portal 2, which coincidentally both use valve's Source engine, albeit rougher image quality in Half-Life because it has been ported to this engine while it was in its early days. It does become a little addicting once you start playing because you start at ground zero and have to work your way out of [strike]hell[/strike] the facility to escape while others around you are much less fortunate. It isn't the prettiest game out there, nor is it one with a story so intricate that writing it down would result in a book larger than the Harry Potter series, but it is gripping enough that just by playing the first game, (and Half-Life can never be mention without mentioning Half-Life 3) I can understand why fans want a Half-Life 3. Plus the whole series is available for less than $10 during sales (I got mine during the Winter 2016 sale).

Don’t get me wrong Half-Life is an amazing game, a masterpiece in fact that really stands the test of time. However I cannot in good faith recommend this version of the game. Considering this is supposed to be a remade version of the original game it has too many bugs to make it worth a buy. Now these are not bugs from the original game that they just didn’t fix, the game introduces NEW bugs and glitches. While I myself have never experienced anything game breaking or crashes (although I have heard of it happening). I must ask you what's the point in getting it if it's just worse than the original? Not to mention you're missing out on the huge mod scene of the original game.

This game is a fps classic from the 90s. Its a great game and its one of those games where you need to use your brain. Games today are waaay to easy in my opinion and mostly just tell you what and how to keep progressing kinda like the game is playing you other than you playing it. This game however has zero cut scenes and really no help on how to complete an objective which i really like. Also shows how a game can be great without all the fancy graphics and cut scenes. You play as a scientist named freeman and you need to progress through the Black Masa complex after something goes completely wrong. Has a great pace of movement speed and enemies who are very accurate when they shoot you. The Ai/NPC's are not all that stupid. They know how to duck to cover and rush and kill you with out just standing still so you have a clear shot on them. Marines you fight can be brutal at times especially when you are out numbered and out gunned. Even in today of 2016 I enjoyed this classic very much and actualy preffer this type of game over plenty of new ones of today. Just because a game looks good doesnt mean its going to be good. I always wondered why this game was a legend and now I understand. Ill tell you this there will be moments when you will get stuck and this game isnt that easy. If you havent played Half-Life I really recommend that you do. You will see how much back pacing games of today have made compared to some games like this from the 90s. Great music tracks great gameplay and great story all wraped into one. You should buy this game.

Many will say that this is not worth buying if you have the regular game, and that it is almost identical to the original Half-Life. It may be very similar to the original, but Half-Life: Source contains almost 100% of the models from 1998, plus improved shadows, water graphics, ragdolls, etc. I will note that barnacle tongues don't always stick out for some reason. But, despite what most people say, this felt like a completely new experience to me and it was worth every penny.

I saw 2 Marines walking into eachother but that was right after a loading screen and they got out when they saw me.

Half-Life Source is a very well made game.
